intro: Serratula simplex, commonly known as the common sow thistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. Serratula simplex is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in temperate climates.
